title: Add possibility to check for unsupported properties keys to SettingsConverter and clean up the class
description:
Added SettingsConverter#unsupportedPropertiesKeys(...) and used it in SolverPropertiesLoader.

Also added JavaDoc to the SettingsConverter and swapped the naming of the encode/decode methods s.t. encode(String) replaces Strings with their respective escape codes.
The SettingsConverter#convert(...) method previously replaced Strings by their escape codes and vice versa in the order of SettingsConverter#ENCODINGS for both enc and dec.
This might lead to dec(enc(str)) != str in some edge cases so I reversed the order for dec.

The changes still don't guarantee enc(dec(.)) = id(.) in every case, though.

[For more details see the comments for SettingsConverter#ENCODINGS and SettingsConverter#convert())]

title: Add a setting for UI look and feel
description:
This MR adds a setting to choose the look and feel the UI should use.

# Why? 

The "system" LaF doesn't look very good and is (for some reason) the default on my system.

# Features and Impact

New option in the settings: System / Metal look and feel.

title: Files for Github Actions
description:
This MR adds the file necessary for running our tests and quality checks on the CI of Github (called Github Actions).

Operation can be observed here https://github.com/wadoon/key-playground/pull/2411

Required for migration to Github


Note, this enables PMD and Checkstyle via Gradle.

title: TokenMgrErr in issue dialogs
description: These errors are currently not caught with line and column number. I added them (at least for one case) to the existing infrastructure.

title: Always load correct example on double click
description:
Small fix to double click behaviour in the "Load Examples" dialog.
Previously, a double click on an unrelated part of the selection tree would not update the selected entry and therefore load the wrong example.

title: Update Checkstyle configuration to latest Checkstyle version
description:
This MR updates the Checkstyle configuration to be compatible with recent Checkstyle versions (tested: 10.2, 10.6).
It also adds the three automatic formatting commits to `.git-blame-ignore-revs`.

# Features and Impact

Users of the IntelliJ Checkstyle plugin will need to change the Checkstyle version in the settings.

# After the MR is merged

Update the wiki page: https://git.key-project.org/key/key/-/wikis/Code%20Conventions

title: Keep original PositionInfo in ForToWhileTransformation
description:
Currently when the For-to-While transformation is applied the PositionInfo that was previously in the *for* object is lost.

This commit adds the PositionInfo of the original *for* statement to the (newly created) *while* statement, so the sourcecode line from which the for/while originated can be traced back.

I originally needed this in the branch for my thesis, but Wolfram thought this would be useful in the main branch.

title: Reducing the binary filesize by only including the necessary example files
description: Currently the entire examples directory (15MB when zipped) is included in our single-file key jar-file. However, most files from that repo cannot be accessed anyway. This MR scans the README.txt files that define the examples for the files they require and only adds those files to the zip file. Its size is neglegible afterwards.

title: Fix typo in comment
description: '*' is not a bitmask operation and doesn't match the `binaryAnd` function. '&' was meant here.

title: Immediately resize proof tree font
description: Partial fix of #1648.

title: Fix Z3 counterexample generation
description: Really simple fix to make counterexample generation work again. Apparently, it was forgotten to specify the special `Z3CESocket` when refactoring the SMT solver specifications into `.props` files.

title: Improve naming in recently used files dropdown
description:
Improves naming of files to distinguish them directly in the dropdown.

Example with two paths that both end in `src`.

![java_oVvhoe0WYv](/uploads/b2c7c4f858416afcf7141291280e1734/java_oVvhoe0WYv.png)

Before, this would have been two entries named `src`.

The algorithm to achieve this is a bit complicated but I tested it extensively. 
I didn't find any existing work for this (however, most IDEs do it somehow).

title: Fix PosInProgram
description: Fixes a bug in position in program and adds tests

title: Prepare build.gradle scripts for Gradle 8.0
description: The JavaCC plugin still uses a deprecated feature, but there is no updated version available at the moment

title: Some code cleanup
description: Some general code cleanup

title: A collection for some (straight forward) of the SonarQube reliability bugs
description: Fixed some of the reported reliability bugs.

title: Second version of the fix for #1716: Check for correct polarity when applying taclets
description:
This MR serves as a replacement for the older, inefficient !557.
@lukas I included your more efficient polarity check, thanks!

title: Un-clutter the context menus in the proof tree view
description:
The current context menu is very cluttered and not sorted by usefulness (imo).

**Info:** This proposal was discussed in the latest KaKeY meeting and deemed worth implementing.
Since this is a greater GUI change, a feedback period starts now and ends on the 17th december 2022.
Use this time to bring up bigger changes as they will probably be hard or tedious to implement later.

As an additional change the right click menu in the sequent view will be replaced with the left click menu.
Left clicks will remain unchanged.

## Current state
Context menu entries that have nothing to do with the selected node:

* Hide XXX
* Expand/Collaps XXX (without below)

Also the following entries seem not very useful:

* Expand/Collaps XXX (without below)
* Previous and Next Sibling
* Search? Why not just keep the search box always open? It isn't that large. Also Ctrl Shift F is pretty obvious.
* Apply strategy: Who even uses this? It's almost always Full auto pilot or Close goals below

The auto pilot macros have waaaaaay higher usage and are hidden under **two** submenu levels.

![java_v9VO40MYdh](/uploads/b3fa74d0a2c2d8cc30d19f02f5b7b720/java_v9VO40MYdh.png)

## Proposition

### Context menu
I think this should be rearranged to be in line with usage:

* Apply strategy
* Prune Proof
* Full auto pilot
* Close provable goals below
* Submenu for other macros
  * Flatten this one with dividers between the categories
* Previous/Next sibling
* Expand/collaps *below*
* Set all goals *below* to interactive/automatic
* Open node in different buffer
* Show subtree statistics

Options that were completely removed:
* Diff with parent, this is superceded by heat maps and is still accessible under View > Visual Node Diff

### Settings dropdown
Furthermore, add a separate settings dropdown to the proof tree view like this one from IntelliJ:

![idea64_o1IVXGEUdz](/uploads/38d6fe8670905933e2d9b55ca0bcda3b/idea64_o1IVXGEUdz.png)

* Expand/Collaps all
* Expand OSS when expanding entries (*new entry*, see !563)
* Search toggle
* Hide XXX
* Show taclet info (inner nodes only)

Supercedes !563.

title: Gui: Update log button, use Desktop.open instead of edit, fix an exception and log format on windows
description:
Updates the log button to be smaller and an icon instead of text + icon.

Use Desktop.open instead of edit to open log externally since edit does not work on Windows (throws IOException).
Please check that this works as intended on Linux as well.
@pfeifer 

Fix an exception propagation issue when contract factory method `loadFrom` throws an exception.

Force log file format to utf-8 to fix it not being readable on Windows.

title: Improve smt solver checking on windows
description:
Use PATHEXT to build all valid extensions for PATH variables.
This allows using the default settings on windows or like one would expect from programs registered in the path variable. Creating the solver is done via ProcessBuilder which uses the native windows open process function. This function checks the PATH variable in a similar way.

Should work on Linux as before since the PATHEXT arg is checked for nonexistance. Please somebody on Linux check.

@pfeifer @appelhagen

title: Move subprojects to top level
description:
This MR addresses task 6 of #1728 and moves all subprojects and files that are currently in subfolders to the top level of the repo.
This MR also adapts the CI scripts (Gitlab and Jenkins) and has some small additions and reformulations in the top-level README.

TODOs:
- [x] move projects to top level
- [x] adapt CI scripts
- [ ] We should consider streamlining our packages (`de.uka.ilkd.key` vs `org.key_project.org`).

title: Fix leftover files that are not formatted properly
description: Because it is really annoying me.

title: Improved taclet error reporting
Fix #1702: Allow declaration of function symbols in custom key file and to use them in JML via \dl
description: The JML specifications were read before the sort, functions etc declaration. This order is now switched.

title: Fix issue #1707
description:
Proof loader adds information like interactive rule application first after a successful application of the rule. Otherwise the status of the node is corupt causing strange behavior of the prover later on, e.g. macros do not run.

The macros failed due to a NPE when creating some statistics.

title: Add triggers to textual representations of taclets
description:
For KeY taclets, there is the rarely used feature of *triggers* (in fact, it is only used by the taclets *bsum_split* and *bprod_find*. However, in the textual representation of taclets the triggers are not included, as I already mentioned in https://git.key-project.org/key/key/-/merge_requests/597#note_19356. This MR does three very related things: * It adds triggers in toString() of Taclet/FindTaclet. * It adapts the test case for taclet equality accordingly. * It adds triggers to the output produced by LogicPrinter, which is relevant for the Info tab in the GUI:
![ruleinfo_taclet_triggers_marked](/uploads/7bcc1afb3d02932bec8096cad8540296/ruleinfo_taclet_triggers_marked.png) ## Pointer to info about triggers In case you are interested: The triggers feature is documented in the KeY book in section 5.4.2 (p. 164). This is how triggers look like in the taclet bsum_split: ```tex bsum_split { \schemaVar \term int low, high; \schemaVar \term int middle; \find(bsum{uSub;}(low, high, t)) \varcond(\notFreeIn(uSub, low), \notFreeIn(uSub, middle), \notFreeIn(uSub, high)) \replacewith(\if(low <= middle & middle <= high) \then(bsum{uSub;}(low, middle, t) + bsum{uSub;}(middle, high, t)) \else(bsum{uSub;}(low, high, t))) \heuristics(comprehension_split, triggered) \trigger {middle} bsum{uSub;}(low, middle, t) \avoid middle <= low, middle >= high; }; ```

title: Add gen folder to gitignore
description: The `gen/` is created by the IntelliJ ANTLR Plugin during the evaluation/testing of grammar files.

title: Formatted rules
description:
This merge request contains the formatted KeY rules. The formatter can be found on `wiesler/keyFileFormatter`.

Modalities are currently only indented as a block (internal indentation is kept), many of them were and are formatted horribly.
However, since they are a single token in the lexer, it is harder to format them better.

Everything else should be formatted consistently now, if you find anything off, please tell me.

The most meaningful test I currently did was remove all whitespace from the formatted and original file and compare them for equality.
This test succeeds.

## Conventions
* Blocks: K & R style
* One statement per line
* At most 1 empty line between statements (comments count as statements)
* Force some things on a separate line
  * Taclet "statements"
  * Closing brackets of most constructs (not in terms, e.g. `{\subst u}` stays as it is)
* No more than 3 `varcond` as a one liner, chop down if more
* No trailing whitespace
* Keep additional line breaks, indent the broken lines correctly
* Preserve shape of comments (e.g. internal indentation)
* Modalities are currently not formatted, only indented to the correct level

#### Indent
* Indent everything with 4 Spaces (configurable)
  * Comments
  * Constructs
  * Broken lines
* Brackets increase indentation level
* After goal spec labels and add new line
```
"Label":
    \replacewith(==> x);
```
* After `\if` if broken on multiple lines
```
\if(x)
    \then(a)
    \else(b)
```

#### Spaces
As far as I know like in Java.
* No spaces around function brackets, neither `f( a )` nor `f (a)`
* Spaces around operators like in Java
  * Except unary operators, dots, and `::`
* Before opening brackets
* After commas in lists
* After `//` and `/*` (some exceptions like `/**` exist)
* After semicolons if something except a bracket follows it
  * e.g. `\forall x; l`
  * `bsum{uSub;}` is kept without a space
* Between ifthenelse: `\if(x) \then(a) \else(b)`

title: Remove highlighting artifacts in SequentView with Unicode symbols enabled
description:
This MR contains a very small fix to get rid of annoying drawing artifacts of highlights in SequentView if Unicode symbols are enabled.

| with artifacts | fixed |
| ------ | ------ |
|   ![artifacts](/uploads/e712773815f666b11216067b6385aa3f/artifacts.gif)      | ![fixed](/uploads/69b00863860c78904390bb63aa94ec78/fixed.gif)|

It is solved by an additional call to `repaint()`. It would probably not be necessary to repaint the whole component, but is is certainly easier and less error prone than calculating the rectangle, and I think it is better to keep the code simple.

title: New shell script to separate allowed_fail tests on Jenkins
description: Additional changes to !589 to keep up with the Master-Pipeline on Jenkins.

title: Tooltip for the exloration status label
description: Tooltip for the exploration label in the status line.

title: Suppress logback message before configuration
Stop the message about java_profile.jfr
description:
* Change from `afterEvaluate` to `doLast` in `key.ui/build.grade`
* Revised message

Addresses #1725

title: Disable proof_references + symbolic_execution
Redux additions
description:
This MR contains additional useful library functions which all exist in the Java 1.6 SDK:
* `Math`: `max`, `min`, `abs` for `int` and `long`
* `Arrays`: `copyOf`, `copyOfRange`, `equals` and `fill` for all primitive types. I have proven the `int` and `float` version of the OpenJDK's implementation, they all run without interactions and are included in the run all functional proofs test.
* `Arrays.equals` for `float` and `double` are excluded since they use bitwise equality

Should the `Arrays.sort` overloads be added as well?

title: Fix for #1723 (Rebase after Spotless)
description:
This branch concerns the soundness/type error issue filed in #1723.
This merge request substitutes !585 after a rebase was necessary due to spotless.

To this end, I updated the comparison taclets in `javaRules.key` to only permit `SimpleExpressionNonFloatDouble`s.
In particular, this version of KeY rejects the proof in Update 2 of #1723.

I looked for further instances of equality, inequality, and comparison that might be relevant, however, it seems the ones I modified are the only ones in need of modification.
In particular, `compound_equality_comparison_1` does not need modification because it simplifies to another instance of `==`.

title: Spotless: Don't join manually split lines
description:
See also here for a discussion where vscode-java reverted this behaviour because it is behaviour originating from Eclipse:
https://github.com/redhat-developer/vscode-java/issues/2181

**Disclaimer**: I know this is nothing an automatic formatting tool *can* decide since it is objective but it should be allowed to happen for readability reasons. This merge request is *conservative*, does not mandate changes on any other code (spotless check does not complain) and only allows the developer to insert additional newlines. 
Before spotless was applied to the whole codebase this might have been debatable but right now I think spotless is too restrictive.

## Chained function calls

Even when they are manually split for readability they will always be forced to fill the lines by spotless
```
a.longName()
   .longName()
   .shortName()
   .shortName()
   .longName()
```
Gets *forced* to 
```
a.longName()
   .longName()
   .shortName().shortName()
   .longName()
```

Example: `JavaProfile.java`
```
builtInRules = builtInRules.prepend(WhileInvariantRule.INSTANCE)
                .prepend(LoopScopeInvariantRule.INSTANCE)
                .prepend(BlockContractInternalRule.INSTANCE)
                .prepend(BlockContractExternalRule.INSTANCE)
                .prepend(LoopContractInternalRule.INSTANCE)
                .prepend(LoopContractExternalRule.INSTANCE)
                .prepend(UseDependencyContractRule.INSTANCE).prepend(getOneStepSimpilifier())
                .prepend(QueryExpand.INSTANCE).prepend(MergeRule.INSTANCE)
                .prepend(LoopApplyHeadRule.INSTANCE).prepend(JmlAssertRule.ASSERT_INSTANCE)
                .prepend(JmlAssertRule.ASSUME_INSTANCE);
```
This is not nice to read and the second prepend call per line can easily be missed.

## The same problem with function parameters

Sometimes one parameter per line, sometimes three. Same applies to function calls. Again, forced upon the developer, newlines get actively deleted by spotless. Example: `JMLTermFactory.java`
```
private SLExpression simpleQuantifier(Term preTerm, Term bodyTerm, KeYJavaType declsType,
            ImmutableList<LogicVariable> declVars, boolean nullable, KeYJavaType resultType,
            BiFunction<QuantifiableVariable, Term, Term> combine,
            BiFunction<Term, Term, Term> combineQuantifiedTerms)
```

title: Apply Spotless to code base: Source code reformatting (no license headers)
description:
Second version (replaces !565) of the MR that applies Spotless to the code base of KeY.
This mainly includes white space formatting and many manual formatting corrections.

## Changes compared to !565
* No license headers are included, as they are problematic with Spotless (see https://git.key-project.org/key/key/-/wikis/KaKeY%202022-09-30).
* Indentation changes to .key files did not really work and are postponed to a later MR.
* MR is based on current master.

# Commits
The branch is cleaned up in the sense that it only contains four commits:
* d76c8cd276ec7da8273a91ed593c5acd62a61611 contains the definition of the code style in the xml file
* d1be82c163b48fcc87991afc33f50c1380bf4949 contains the automatic reformatting for Java (massive changes)
* f8441bba87de6fdc63ea3078a9fa0c79139b8b0a contains the automatic reformatting for .key files (only removal of trailing whitespace)
* e405e67cb69ac9621efaa6098e87d03fb39a3efa contains the manual corrections
This should hopefully make it as easy as possible to merge older branches into master in the future, and also opens up the possibility to ignore the commits with `git blame` (see documentation below).

# Documentation
https://www.key-project.org/docs/devel/SpotlessAutomaticFormatting (upcoming)

# Known caveats
* Enforcing braces on single line if/for/... statements is not possible automatically.
* String literals in code are not split/joined.
* Line comments after arguments of method calls frequently exceed the 100 chars line length limit (see #1710).
* Some fragments (for example JavaDoc `@link`s with long signatures, long import statements, long type declarations, ...) produce still too long lines, but I think there is no better formatting.
* Since the manual reformatting is laborious, I did it just for the particularly strange cases (see #1710 for some of them) in the main sources. In particular, I did no manual reformatting in the recoder sub-project, test cases, and resources.

title: Fix widening casts and boxing of extension primitive types like bigint
description:
Fixes #1724.

Makes all extension types non coercing except:
* Casts from any smaller int type to `\bigint` are considered widening
* Casts form any smaller float type and all int types including `\bigint` to `\real` are considered widening

title: Run the Javac compiler on loading
description:
Run the Javac compiler on loaded Java files in KeY to ensure well-formnedness. 

Implementation detail: The current version is now written as a KeYGuiExtension with no impact to the `key.core`. There is no dialog popping up after loading if an issue is found. Instead, we have an indicator in the status line saying whether (fine, warnings, errors). A mouse click lead to the issue dialog. 

It is still asynchronous.

title: Temporarily disable reloading sort.proof.gz because of #1720
description: This is just a temporal solution to mitigate #1720. To make Jenkins pass and to be able to merge MR unrelated to #1720.

title: Fix Jenkins master script after !559
description: Jenkins failed on master, apparently since that job was using `key/scripts/jenkins/runTests.sh` rather than `Jenkinsfile`. This MR should fix this by modifying the former, too.

title: Fast fix: Do not run pipeline defined by the Jenkinsfile on "Master" worker
description:
Jenkinsfile is used for the pipeline definition for merge requests. Currently, this pipeline is also executed on the "Master" Jenkins worker. Due to wrong resource handling, this threatens the availability of the Jenkins control UI (which runs on the same machine with the same permissions and user). Currently mainly happened by non-dying z3 processes.

This MR disables this special worker node for Jenkins builds on merge requests.

title: ChoiceExpr: En-/Disabling taclets/goal templates using boolean expression
description:
This MR improves the enabling and disabling of taclets and goal templates by using a boolean expression instead of an option list. 

## Current situation

Taclets and goal templates can be disabled or activated according to a list of activated choices. These choices are given as a list either in the rules directive, e.g., `\rules(cat1:a, cat2:b) {...}` or `(cat1:a,cat2:b) { <goal> }`. A taclet or goal template is activated iff the activated choices are a superset of the required choices.

## New situation

Additionally to a list of choices, you are able to specify a boolean expression (built over and, or, not and choices) to determine when a taclet or goal template should be activated. 

The grammar changes as follows: 

```
option_list: LPAREN ( (option (COMMA option)*) 
                    | option_expr)  RPAREN;

option_expr: option_expr '&' option_expr
           | option_expr '|' option_expr 
           | '!' option_expr
           | '(' option_expr ')'  
           | option
           ; 
```

Internally, the data structure had to be changed from a set of choices to an AST.

title: Fix three memory leaks
description: To ease reviewing, each fix is done in a separate commit.

title: Focus first cell in the taclet instantiation dialog on open
description: This allows faster navigation without having to touch the mouse.

title: Close more dialogs on escape press
description: Title. Also does some code deduplication.

title: Fix exception when parsing unknown source name in BuildingException
description:
Prevents an exception when calling `BuildingException::getLocation` with an offending symbol from an unknown source name.
This tries to parse the url `<unknown>` which is not a valid url (at least on Windows), throws an exception and prevents the error dialog to even show.

title: Disable exploration tree updates when disabled
description:
This MR disables exploration tree updates when the exploration tree is disabled.

I've noticed that those updates take a huge amount of time since they are at least linear in the size of the *whole proof tree* (as far as I see it) making every rule application take at least linear time and the whole update a bottleneck for large proofs. Those updates are not needed at all while the exploration tree is disabled which this MR fixes.
Ideally, they should not run while the autopilot is running since intermediate states can't be observed anyways.

@lanzinger please check that this does what I think it does, if I'm correct `createModel` ditches all old state and regenerates it freshly so doing lazy updates should be fine.

title: Remove space from taclet proof save file name
description:
Title. This brings the name generated for taclet proof files in line with the existing taclet proof files in the repository.

Before:
```
Taclet_ xyz.proof
```

Now:
```
Taclet_xyz.proof
```

This change is conservative and changes only taclet proof file names. 
I think all spaces could be removed from the file name beforehand since taclet names and contracts can't contain spaces. If this is desired it would be simple addition.

title: New rules from the sorting case study
description:
This MR contains many new rules created and proven during my master's thesis.
The commits are self contained (except for pow using some of the earlier ones) and should be safe to merge.
All rules are lemmas and the proofs are attached.

Feedback is wanted, especially which rules should be contained in which heuristic, especially on the integer pow rules.

### Integer pow
Definition of integer pow and log as well as many lemmas for working with them.

### Disjoint array ranges
Array ranges in locsets didn't have good rules and relied on working with the general disjoint definition.
The added rules speed up proving disjointnesses by a large margin.

### Bsum rules
Many rules for lower and upper bounds of bsums, bsum subtraction and bsum ordering.

### Bprod rules
Splitting bprod and proving `>= 1`.

### Small quality of life rules
* `equivAllRight`
* `ifthenelse_equals` (comes up a lot when proving observer dependencies of boolean model methods)
* prevent recursion when translating shift left / right which blew up the sequent
* `seqPermSplit` which I found more intuitive to use than `seqPermConcatFW`/`seqPermConcatBW`

@mulbrich

title: fix ghost statements
Replay progress display
description:
This MR adds a replay progress "loading bar".

# Why? 

Some progress indication when loading a proof allows the user to estimate the total time.

# Features and Impact

GUI changes: when loading a proof, replay progress is displayed in the lower left corner

# Persons involved

by commit: @keller  
by idea: #687 may be related

title: Split `testRunAllProofs` into two tasks
description:
This MR: 

1. Splits `testRunAllProofs` into two task (`testRunAllInfProofs` and `testRunAllFunProofs`) and use separate Jenkins stages. 

   This allows you to assign an error easier to test cases, and allows a specific re-run.

2. Adds a stage for `spotlessCheck` in Jenkins (allow to fail)


Ready to merge:

![image](/uploads/a1bcc967f9e39a24fb6ce6c5a3c64060/image.png)

title: Fix specification order
description:
I just found out that MR !306 unexpectedly changed the order of method specification clauses.
The referenced MR removed the implicit specification label from the implicit non-null specification clauses, which resulted in most of the well-definedness checks not being provable anymore. I found this bug using a git bisect and still do not understand why the referenced MR removed the label as the description does not mention it by any means.

title: avoid creating proof obligations in ProofManagementDialog
description:
avoid creating proof obligations in `ProofManagementDialog`

# Why? 

Most of the proof obligations in `ProofManagementDialog` are created just to check if there is a closed proof for a contract which is unnessesary, additionally it makes encountering #1715 unlikely as you have to start an information flow proof first.

# Impact
 
> Which components should have changed and how?

`ProofManagementDialog` will only create a proof obligation if and when it starts a proof

It is unnecessary to create proof obligations in most cases there and
creating some proof obligations changes state shared with a large part
of KeY (see #1715).

This does **not** fix #1715, just makes it unlikely to encounter as
you now first have to start an information flow proof and then in a
proof for another class try to cut on `self`, in the cut dialog KeY will
think `self` comes from the information flow proof.

As a workaround for #1715 do all information flow proofs you want to do
last.

# Review

> Are there any places that should be reviewed more closely?
> Where there any uncertainties during development?

Are all contracts `ProofManagementDialog` will handle atomic?
It seems like that should be the case if you can't select more than one contract together in that dialog (which seems to be the case, but I'm not sure)

Why are the proof obligations created with `initConfig.copyWithServices(initConfig.getServices())`?
I would have expected them to get `initConfig` directly as being given a `InitConfig` should already mean they aren't allowed to modify that object, but there giving a copy with shared services makes modifying seem to work for some modifications.

# Persons involved

fixes TODO added in b1c1bc79f695e27fa5f70a7c6fa67a5a09e9b7d0 by @rbubel

workaround for most cases of #1715

found by debugging #1715 together with @lanzinger

title: Restore Information FlowTests
description:
Apparently, the InfFlowTests were got removed in 931db5f7. This MR restores the original file.

Replaces !552.

title: fixes #1711
description:
A small tweak to remove labels from variable declarations in generated test cases.

Needed for Felix' project. @flist, can you have a look if this really solves your issue?

title: jdiv and jmod support in SMT translation via definitions.
description:
Small change to support jmod and jdiv via definitions in new SMT translation.

Special casing of jdiv no longer needed and has been removed.

/cc @pfeifer @appelhagen

title: Solve missing plugin in shadowJar by adding `mergeServiceFiles()`
description:
Solve missing plugin in shadowJar by adding `mergeServiceFiles()` to the shadowJar task. 

Also some minor changes for upcoming deprecation.

title: More descriptive names for result variables
description:
Variables representing the returned value of a method call currently only are named `result` or `result_25`. This MR provides a very small fix that appends the name of the called method. This should make it much more apperent to the user what the variable actually represents:
| current | with this MR |
| ------ | ------ |
| ![result_variable_naming_before](/uploads/3d879a7ef822adb523717061991c7d40/result_variable_naming_before.png) | ![result_variable_naming_after](/uploads/69aabdecfd9ecaddbc04c162c28aa739/result_variable_naming_after.png) |

The java code contains calls to the methods maxX(int[]), minX(int[]), and abs(int).

# Impact

This MR will break reloadability of some older proofs, e.g., if a result variable appeared in a cut.

# Further Information
I also experimented a bit with also including the signature of the method into the variable name, e.g. `result_abs_int`. However, this did not work well:
* It has problems with arrays due to the brackets.
* It may greatly increase the length of the variable name.
* It does not give much benefit, since in most cases probably not many overloaded methods are called.

Another solution would be to add the actual parameter values in the variable name, e.g. the Java code `String.valueOf(charArray, offset, count)` would give us a varname `result_valueOf_charArray_offset_count`. This solution would also greatly increase the varname length, while having problems with concrete values (How to format for example `abs(-105)`?).
Also, in the implementation it is very difficult to get the actual parameters.

So I decided to stick with the original and very simple solution.

title: Multiplication for rule costs
description:
This MR introduce the multiplication for `RuleAppCost`, i.e., `RuleAppCost#mul(RuleAppCost)`. 

Useful function from !206, which will move to `wadoon/key-tools`.

title: Housekeeping: Logging
description:
This MR does some housekeeping stuff: 

* adjust/repair the verbosity level for logging 
  `-v` only impacts console output and not the file output
* fixes warnings around wrongly used logger calls 
  `log.warn("..." + obj);` vs. `log.warn("... {}", obj);`
* max logging file sizes
* `logback` for logging in test cases. 
  sl4j-simple does not allow change of configuration dynamically (required for run-all-proofs). 

* Sets pre-allocation sizes for Recoder2KeY mappings

title: fixing #1709
description:
Should quickfix #1709.

This does not remove the actual problem, but makes sure that a UI bug does not corrupt the proof tree.

title: Fix file filter for .proof.gz files
description: Provides a fix for #1705.

title: support \old() in jml asserts
description:
adds support for `\old(‚Ä¶)` in jml asserts

# Why? 

`\old(‚Ä¶)` support was accidentally omitted in !494. This MR also fixes using `\old()` on method parameters in jml asserts (see #1686).

# Features and Impact

You can use `\old(‚Ä¶)` in jml asserts again and additionally `\old()` on method parameters is translated correctly.

This needed support in IntroAtPreDefsOp which wasn't really extendable, so I changed it to use a Visitor to do the renamings, making it easier to extend and reducing duplication.
To handle the renamings I extracted the `ReplacementMap` classes from `AbstractAuxiliaryContractImpl` to have them generally useable.
Some visitors needed more support for jml asserts.
Now the `ProgramVariableCollection` gets created directly in JmlSpecFactory for jml asserts as `AuxiliaryContract.VariablesCreator` does more work than needed in that case.

# Review

Testing on real world examples would be nice, to see if there are still feature combinations that aren't supported correctly.

@wiesler can you test this branch on your examples?

title: implement some features of the jml assert wishlist #1700
description:
Improve some jml assert displaying related stuff.

# Why? 

As outlined in #1700 the printing of jml assume/assert stuff could be better

# Features and Impact

The name of the rule changes to `JML assert`/`JML assume` and uses lower case `assert`/`assume` when pretty printing `JmlAssert`. Saved proofs which used the rule on assums will not propperly reload as the name changed!

Uses `LogicPrinter.quickPrintTerm` now to pretty print the condition as it is better than just converting to text and the real term pretty printer isn't accessable from there.

# Review

As outlined in #1700 it would be nicer to have seperate `JML assert` and `JML assume` in the proof tree, the only way I see for that is having two instances of the rule, is there some better way to do that?

~~Is there some good way to pretty print the condition? is `LogicPrinter.quickPrintTerm(cond, null)` good enought if it works?~~ (`LogicPrinter.quickPrintTerm` seems ok)

# Persons involved

ideas by @lukas in #1700

title: suggested automation for seqPerm
description:
Proofs with permutation properties must usually be conducted manually even though there is no magic involved.

This MR suggests a few rules to better deal with transitivity cases.

Moreover, added lemmata (and the transitivity of permutation) have been proven.

title: ensure that the condition of a JML assert statement is always a formula (fixes #1698)
description:
The condition is always some boolean expression, so it gets translated
to either a formula or boolean Term, so normalize that to formula as
that is what the rule needs in the end.

Do it directly when translating the Term, to reject programs early where the
expression isn't boolean.

Additionally treat `self` correctly and replace it in the condition (if it isn't `null`)

As mentoined in !494 and #1698 `\old()` in JML asserts is currently broken and I'm looking into fixing it, should that fix also become part of this MR?

/cc @lanzinger @wiesler

title: remove pointless extension of CreatingASTVisitor by MergeRuleUtils.CollectLocationVariablesVisitor
description:
As the name say `MergeRuleUtils.CollectLocationVariablesVisitor` only collects stuff in the AST and doesn't change
anything so the work `CreatingASTVisitor` does is unnessesary.
So extend `JavaASTVisitor` directly instead.

This makes `CollectLocationVariablesVisitor` independent of `CreatingASTVisitor`, so changing `CreatingASTVisitor` doesn't affect it.

##### (Stuff for an issue/another pull request)
There is also some duplication there as there are actually two classes doing the same with the only diffrence what collection they collect the `LocationVariable`s into, but I have no idea why, performance? Are there reasons to prefer one over the other in some cases or is one variant always better and the other should get removed? 

According to git this was implemented by "Dominic Scheurer" in 2015, but I don't see a account for him on gitlab

title: Performance: pause tree updates while executing "Set All Goals Below to XX"
description:
Changing the status of a goal calls the listener automaticStateChanged in GuiProofTreeModel which filters and updates the whole tree *twice*.

This change pauses tree updating done by the listener and performs one update at the end.

Before, the GUI froze for ~40s for large proofs, now it is well below a second.

title: Try to fix heap/permissions/threads example #1689
description: Sound proofs of Plotter.startTransfer in heap/permissions/threads example need an additional precondition. The calculus will be fixed later.

title: Fixed rule "wellFormedStoreObjectEQ"
description: The variable condition determining the sort of field "f" was missing, leading to an NPE upon application

title: Repairing JML interpretation of equality on floats and doubles.
description:
Currently, the new float translation translates `f1 == f2` to *f1 = f2* in JavaDL. But it should not since equality on floats is different and should be translated to the respective equality predicates.

This is under the assumption that `f1 == f2` should mean the same in Java and JML.

title: Fix #1678
description: This branch fixes #1678 and overhauls part of the `SourceView` functionality: Instead of collecting the Java files to be shown in the `SourceView` separately for each proof node and propagating the files to children nodes (which is what caused #1678 as well as various problems where expected files would only be shown for some proof nodes), we now have only one list of Java files per proof.

title: fix error in logging formatting strings
description:
Some formatting logging strings were corrupted during the introduction of slf4j. 

This MR fixes them.

title: fix the collection of JUnit tests on jenkins
description:
Currently, only the JUnit XML files of the normal test cases are collected and uploaded. 

This MR fix this and also add *run-all-proofs* and *proof-rules* tests.

title: Load some (old) proofs with wrong/missing instantiations of \assumes in taclet app
description:
There are cases where the `\asumes` clause in a taclet is added or changed, for example in !513. Previously to that MR, we were not able to load proofs where those modified rules were applied.

With the MR we will replay taclet applications, given that there are unique instatiations of `\assumes` formulas.

Otherwise, we would have to manually change `.proof` files in KeYs unit tests for !513. This also applies for potential future changes to the calculus.

This also adds new tests for the new feature in testRunAllProofs. The test property `notloadable` is added.

title: Show message of the chained cause of the exception in IssueDialog
description: Solves #1688.

title: Replace the hardcoded SolverType classes by .props files
description: Makes adding new SolverTypes easier for devs. Instead of adding a new class for every solver that implements the SolverType interface, a .props file should suffice (unless a new subclass of AbstractSolverSocket is needed as well).

title: Graetz new fix1598
description:
Another attempt to fix #1598 

This MR adds to all kinds of class invariant/axiom rules the  `\assumes` side conditions `self != null`, where `Sort.exactInstance(self)` is missing. This is the proper way to fix #1598.

Changed rules are in `TacletGenerator.java`, including:

* [x] `Class_invariant_axiom_for_...` / `Definition_axiom_for_...` where `...` is a final class:
  ```
  \assumes ( ==> self = null )
  ```
* (unchanged) `Class_invariant_axiom_for_...` / `Definition_axiom_for_...` where `...` is not a final class:
  ```
  \assumes ( Sort.exactInstance(self) ==> )
  ```
* [x] `Partial_inv_axiom_for_JML_class_invariant_nr_..._in_...`
  ```
  \assumes ( ==> self = null )
  ```
* [x] `Partial_inv_axiom_for_JML_class_invariant_nr_..._in_..._EQ`
  ```
  \assumes ( self = EQ ==> EQ = null )
  ```
* [ ] I am not sure whether to include an additional EQ version:
  ```
  \assumes ( self = EQ ==> self = null )
  ```

Requires !516 since I do not want to change old proofs in symbolic execution tests.

title: Fix #1685
description: Set the interactive flag for builtin rule applications coming from `BuiltInRuleMenuItem` correctly.

title: Fix #1684
description: Used `Validator<Number>` instead of `<Integer>` or `<T extends Number>` for the number field creation.

title: Fix potential stack overflow in ExplorationStepsList
description: Fix potential stack overflow in `ExplorationStepsList` by replacing the recursive search for exploration nodes in the proof tree with a depth-first iterative search.

title: Autopilot Performance: hasModality
description:
Save if a term contains a modality because it is used overwhelmingly often in `AutoPilotStrategy::computeCost` and the recursion is very costly for long and deep sequents.

## Benchmarks
Rough benchmarks. Only the ratios are representative since they ran different total times.

Before [ms]:
```
AutoPilotPrepareProofMacro.COMPUTE_COST: 53759.6363 (100% of total)
AutoPilotPrepareProofMacro.COMPUTE_COST per op: 0.03086464435662914
AutoPilotPrepareProofMacro.HAS_MODALITY: 51279.5068 (95% of total)
AutoPilotPrepareProofMacro.HAS_MODALITY per op: 0.03006072394985767
AutoPilotPrepareProofMacro.DELEGATE: 2318.5139 (4% of total)
AutoPilotPrepareProofMacro.DELEGATE per op: 0.001582434839703076
```

After [ms]:
```
AutoPilotPrepareProofMacro.COMPUTE_COST: 697.1121 (100% of total)
AutoPilotPrepareProofMacro.COMPUTE_COST per op: 9.396156147898943E-4
AutoPilotPrepareProofMacro.HAS_MODALITY: 15.5442 (2% of total)
AutoPilotPrepareProofMacro.HAS_MODALITY per op: 2.150119096032069E-5
AutoPilotPrepareProofMacro.DELEGATE: 621.4485 (89% of total)
AutoPilotPrepareProofMacro.DELEGATE per op: 0.0014724906939879963
```

As can be seen most time is now actually spent in the delegate (whatever this does) instead of traversing the formula over and over again.

Reduces the time needed for a previously tough preparation only from 60s to 2s.

## Further work
I think what I did is correct since `Term`, `Sequent` and `Node` are immutable. If you find a better place for this boolean I'm open to proposals.

I did not test the impact on small formulas but since it is only a single boolean that is only calculated once on construction this should not have any noticeable impact.

title: Fixing #1681 and #1682
description:
smaller glitches in the grammars.

Perhaps the JML change needs some more tweaking?

/cc @weigl

title: Resolve "Parsing exception: undeclared variable in an assignable declaration"
description: Closes #1627

title: Add Task runWithProfiler to execute key.ui with the  Java Flight Recoder
description:
This MR just adds a task to `key.ui/build.gradle` that allows you to run key.ui with the Java Flight Recorder (a profiling tool). 

For visualisation of the records you can use Intellij.

title: Attempt to fix #1679
description: Fixes #1679 by using the name conflict resolution of the `TermBuilder` class--which is used by instead of `VariableNamer.getTemporaryNameProposal` for the variables introduced by the block contract.

title: Externalization of Interaction Logging
description:
This MR externalizes the Interaction Logging Plugin: 

* Removal of interaction logging, as announce in KaKeY meeting. 
  * The current state is buggy and incomplete, starting with the broken serialization with JAXB. 
  * Interaction Logging now lives in <https://github.com/wadoon/key-tools>
  * The new version is written in Kotlin. Its integration into the KeY repo was declined. 
* Changes to the interface of some classes, so the new version of interaction logging can work with the master.

Documentation follows.

title: Bug fixes from the IdentityHashMap case study
description:
* `\strictly_nothing` in invariant editor
* infinite recusion on loading 
* two taclets for bsum
* loop treatment in create AST visitor

title: [Hot Fix] Compilation error after merge of weigl/logging.
description: Method `Debug.out` was removed in `weigl/logging`, but was used in MR which was merged before `weigl/logging`.

title: Check formatting  with Spotless
description:
This MR brings [`spotless`](https://github.com/diffplug/spotless/tree/main/plugin-gradle) to the gradle configuration. 

Spotless allows you
 1. to format your code according to the defined rules (task `spotlessApply`).
 2. to check whether your code is well-formatted (task `spotlessCheck`, also done in the gitlab-ci).

Currently, we have separate styles for `.key`, `.java`, and ANTLR `.g4` files (can also be applied/checked separately e.g. via `spotlessJavaApply/Check`).

Spotless supports several code formatters, for Java files we currently use the eclipse formatter which can be configured by an XML-file. This configuration file can be found in `scripts/tools/checkstyle/keyCodeStyle.xml` and is a version of the Google Java Style (https://github.com/google/styleguide/blob/gh-pages/eclipse-java-google-style.xml) adapted to our [code conventions](https://git.key-project.org/key/key/-/wikis/Code%20Conventions).

Running `spotlessApply` will also add license headers to the files.
This MR removes all existing license headers in the single commit c9bc601a (plus some missed remainders in af780f85).

# Further notes
* This MR does **not** apply spotless to reformat the codebase. This will be done in a succeeding MR as discussed and decided in [KaKeY meeting](https://git.key-project.org/key/key/-/wikis/KaKeY-2022-05-13).
* For demonstration or experiments, the reformatted code base (`spotlessApply` run globally) can be found in the branch `pfeiferApplySpotless`.
* Due to technical limitations, it is currently not possible to enforce braces for single statement `if`s (the eclipse formatter can only insert/remove whitespace).
* The spotless check works by applying the specified changes to the code base and then checking the diff with the original. It succeeds iff the diff is empty.

title: Fix two exceptions from #1652
description:
Fixes two exceptions from #1652.

The first one is actually fixed.

The second one does not appear any more but the underlying cause has not been found.
I added some debug info since I found no way to reproduce it consistently.

title: implement JML asserts/assumes as standalone construct instead of transforming into blockcontracts
description:
Implement JML asserts/assumes as standalone construct.

# Why? 

As explained in #1580 the translation is confusing, additionally it causes problems (e.g. #1660 #1669) 

# Features and Impact

This branch adds a standalone construct for JML asserts/assumes and the needed BuiltInRule.

The rule is implemented as
```
\DELTA => update(C), \GAMMA   \DELTA => update(C -> <.. ...>F), \GAMMA
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
               \DELTA => update(<..//@assert C; ...>F), \GAMMA
```

For this the rule and ruleApp was added as well as the statment, once for key and once for recorderext.
The rule was added to the list of builtInRules in JavaProfile.
PrettyPrinter and the Visitors were changed to support the new statement.
JMLTranslator was changed to attach this new Statment instead of a block and SLEnvInput and JMLSpecFactory were adapted to translate the condition.


With this you no longer see those blockcontracts and proofs should get a bit smaller when working with jml asserts


# Review

As there is currently no was to store an JML expression in the AST (e.g. \forall doesn't have a representation), I decided to keep the parse tree in the `JmlAssert` object and then as soon as possible (in `SLEnvInput`) translate that parse tree into a `Term` and <ins>set the parse tree to `null`</ins> <del>keep both in the `JmlAssert` object</del>.

<del>Another idea would be saving the `Term` into `SpecificationRepository` as it is done for block and loop contracts.</del>

<del>@lanzinger suggested that second idea could be the better way as it is at least the same as for other constructs that have to save a `Term`, so I would like to hear other opinions about that (@mulbrich? @weigl?)</del>

The parse tree is kept around <ins>until translated into a `Term`</ins> <del>for translating into a `Term` and pretty printing.</del>

<del>Instead one could keep around the orginal comment or a string form of the condition and reparse that when creating the `Term`.</del>

While I wanted to avoid parsing the condition a second time, it wouldn't be worse then the current implementation on master, as it gets parsed one time in JMLTranslator before creating the block and then a second time in SLEnvInput when the needed information is there to translate the contract to `Term`s.

As some Visitors need special caseing because of the contained Term, I'm not sure if I found all that need that.

<del>Are `JmlAssertRule::isApplicable` and `JmlAssertRule::isApplicableOnSubTerms` ok that way?</del> <ins>should be ok</ins>

<del>Is using  `//@`$kind  as keyword in the PrettyPrinter ok?</del> <ins>Using `@`$kind now</ins>

<del>I have no idea what `BuiltInRuleApp::setIfInsts` should be doing and why it isn't implemented in `AbstractBuiltInRuleApp` as all subclasses seem to do the same.</del>

I still need to write more tests for this.

# Persons involved

idea in #1580 by @mulbrich and @lanzinger 

Edit: add \DELTA and \GAMMA to the rule to make it a bit clearer

Edit2: remove `wellFormed(heap)` from the rule

Edit3: mark some review items outdated via del tag and add some information marked with ins tag

title: Resolve "Taclet leaves a broken tree after failing to apply"
description: Closes #1672

title: fix #1658
description:
This #1658 by 

* adding `THIS` to a regular identifier
* changing the translator
* adding a test case

title: deploy to maven via gitlab-ci
description:
This MR brings two new jobs to `.gitlab-ci.yml`.

- `deploy-nightly` is triggered on branch `stable` automatically, and deploys a `-SNAPSHOT` version to the maven repository. 

- `deploy-release` can be triggered manually on `KeY-*` branches to deploy a non-`-SNAPSHOT` version.
